body: @b-slim I may have blindly added that check out of habit, I think we should allow nulls in the extractiondimfilter
@gianm do we note anywhere that we "expect tasks to choose versions in some way that makes sense, so long as they don't choose one larger than their taskLock version"
@xvrl ah, nope, I just added it to the javadoc.
:+1: after merge conflicts / travis are resolved

@cheddar Given the significant changes to debugging I'm going to close for now. At a cursory glance the re-use of compression buffers is not a drop-in solution due to some of the key areas they would be needed lacking a `close()` to put the buffers back in the pool.
@gianm resolved the merge conflict, jdk8 build actually failed on an unrelated test and hopefully will pass this time.

@drcrallen  issue sub query,will return 4000 rows,the result  as except,because the cardinality of cast is  1000 and  the cardinality of device is 4.
and order by cast and limit as following sql:

``` sql
SELECT device, cast, LONG_SUM(pv_sum) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(uv) as hyper_uv 
FROM dsp_report        
WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00
 AND area = '0A' BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device, cast ORDER BY cast LIMIT 10;
```

> SELECT device, cast, LONG_SUM(pv_sum) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(uv) as hyper_uv 
> FROM dsp_report  
> WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00
>  AND area = '0A' BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device, cast ORDER BY cast LIMIT 8;>>>
> +------------------------+----+----+------------------+------+
> |timestamp               |cast|pv  |hyper_uv          |device|
> +------------------------+----+----+------------------+------+
> 
> ....some rows ignore
> 
> +------------------------+----+----+------------------+------+
> |2015-08-03T16:00:00.000Z|1   |5443|3049.582786719047 |3D    |
> +------------------------+----+----+------------------+------+
> |2015-08-03T16:00:00.000Z|1   |6025|3577.616802569747 |1D    |
> +------------------------+----+----+------------------+------+
> |2015-08-03T16:00:00.000Z|1   |5715|3269.305274221978 |2D    |
> +------------------------+----+----+------------------+------+
> |2015-08-03T16:00:00.000Z|1   |6586|3920.265152070715 |0D    |

in the meaning time,apply this PR,issue the nest sql:

``` sql
SELECT 
   device, LONG_SUM(pv) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(hyper_uv) as hyper_uv 
FROM
  (SELECT
         device, cast, LONG_SUM(pv_sum) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(uv) as hyper_uv 
   FROM dsp_report        
   WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00
   AND area = '0A' BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device, cast
   ) 
WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00 AND cast = 1 BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device ;
```

the result is

> SELECT 
>    device, LONG_SUM(pv) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(hyper_uv) as hyper_uv 
> FROM

>          device, cast, LONG_SUM(pv_sum) as pv, HYPER_UNIQUE(uv) as hyper_uv 
>    FROM dsp_report  
>    WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T0>>>>>>0:00:00
>    AND area = '0A' BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device, cast
>    ) 
> WHERE interval BETWEEN 2015-08-04T00:00:00 AND 2015-08-05T00:00:00 AND cast = 1 BREAK BY 'all' GROUP BY device ;>>>

@fjy thanks for the review.
@gianm I thought more about it and realized that the "assumption" about the hierarchy has to be made in order to be able to do proper cleanup. For example, on deleting partition directory, you can delete interval directory (if empty) by only assuming that interval directory is parent of the partition directory. However, I did add a comment in druid-api https://github.com/druid-io/druid-api/pull/58 and hopefully that should be OK.

I added a test that fails in master but passes with this patch : https://github.com/Hailei/druid/pull/1 

Please confirm this is the case you are encountering
@himanshug ok, I think that given druid-io/druid-api#58 and the fact that this delete is non-recursive, this PR is safe enough to merge.

Getting some hadoop problems now, I think they're due to the jackson upgrade. Looks like hadoop pulls in an older version of the basic jackson jars, but not jackson-datatype-guava, so the newer jackson-datatype-guava of druid blows up when it tries to call into the core jackson stuff.


@gianm I'm ok downgrading to the latest version of jackson that doesn't exhibit the problem, let's try the latest 2.5.x see if that works, since that method was introduced in 2.6.

Long term we need a better way of isolating the hadoop-only parts to they don't hold up the rest of the stack on older versions.

`...we need a better way of isolating the hadoop-only parts to they don't hold up the rest of the stack on older versions`

Failing test at: https://github.com/druid-io/druid/compare/master...gianm:ingest-segment-overlapping?expand=1#diff-8b56e359211a285701b559f7bd1296f4R244

looks like this one is going to impact batch delta ingestion as well, because same code is reused there to read data. We probably should put this one as a known bug inside 0.8.1 release notes till fixed.
Also IngestSegmentFirehoseFactory usage of VersionedIntervalTimeline  looks redundant because IndexerSQLMetadataStorageCoordinator (see https://github.com/druid-io/druid/blob/master/server/src/main/java/io/druid/metadata/IndexerSQLMetadataStorageCoordinator.java#L75 ) does that as well.
I'm :+1: on this. It is experimental and not extremely impacting.

I think we have all the votes we need for this PR. Any more blockers/concerns?

It works for `http://127.0.0.1:12345/`. It fails only when using `http://127.0.0.1:12345`.
Currently we work around by using `http://127.0.0.1:12345/`.
However, we still expect that the POST generator is able to handle `http://127.0.0.1:12345`. Or to illustrate this limitation on documents is also good to avoid this problem.

ok, it's good to know that there is a workaround. Probably the best way to make things work without the slash is to edit NettyHttpClient in http://github.com/metamx/http-client such that empty paths are replaced with /.

LGTM
One of the files got nabbed in a reformat so it looks like more changes than it is.

@himanshug, is this fixing a bug or just general hygiene?

Asking because I have one concern: IIRC most of our hadoop jobs explicitly set a number of reducers (so usually mapreduce.job.reduces doesn't do anything anyway) except for the group-by job under single dimension partitioning. That job needs some way for users to specify the number of reducers, or else it will default to 1 reducer and performance will be poor. mapreduce.job.reduces seems like as good a way as any, especially since I don't think we can necessarily pick a good default for that job.

@drcrallen is the purpose of this so we are using the fastestInstance() everywhere we use LZ4Factory? If so then :+1: from me. As extra credit I think it would also be cool to have a defaultLZ4Factory() method somewhere to keep things consistent in the future.
